metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20551 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A reachable Object::getString assertion in Poppler 0.72.0 allows attackersto cause a denial of service due to construction of invalid rich mediaannotation assets in the AnnotRichMedia class in Annot.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: poppler package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.12').
